# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

reasoning:
**Analyzing the Optimal Play**

Okay, here's the situation. Round 16, Small Blind, aiming for 20,000 chips with three hands and four discards. I've got a decent starting hand with a flush setup, but I need to make sure I'm maximizing my potential given the joker setup I have. I'm focusing on a 4-card Diamond flush thanks to "Four Fingers" to keep it concise, plus "Crafty Joker," "Bootstraps," "Vampire," and "Seltzer" for multipliers. I have $61.

My initial thought is to play the 4-card Diamond flush (7, 6, 5, 3) because it seems I can get close to 20,000 chips. After the calculation of 19,148 I'm seeing this gets me close. However, I need to see if I can get to the 20,000 using only this hand. The Small Blind is 20,000 and if I can reach this in one hand, it's the more optimal play.

I also have three Hearts (10, 9, 4), and the potential for a Straight Flush if I can find a 4 of Diamonds to replace the Heart. I'm thinking of discarding these Hearts to improve my hand. A Straight Flush would definitely hit the target, but even a higher Diamond like an Ace would be ideal. I have a fair chance of drawing a Diamond given the deck composition.

I've got "Seltzer" to retrigger my cards. While I could play the 4-card Diamond flush now and likely get around 19,000, and follow it up with a later hand, if I can hit 20,000 in one hand I save a hand, and save additional money at the end, which is more important. The Blind does not have a "No repeat hand types" requirement, so there is no cost to playing this hand.

So, the optimal strategy here is clear: discard the Hearts and see what I draw. I have four discards, so I'm discarding 10h, 9h, and 4h, and keeping the Diamonds (7, 6, 5, 3). I will hunt for the 4 of Diamonds to secure a Straight Flush, or any other Diamond to maximize my score and reach 20,000 in one hand. This has the highest probability of leading to a one-hand win.
